com.tedros.fxapi.util

Class ClickRepeater

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tedros.fxapi.util.ClickRepeater

  • public final class ClickRepeater
extends java.lang.Object
    Usually a ButtonBase only fires once per mouse click, namely when the mouse is released. This class allows a ButtonBase to periodically fire while armed, e.g. while the mouse is pressed.

    While the button is armed, it waits 500ms to fire the first time. After that it fires every 80ms by default.

    Therefore it mimics the behavior of key press events as they fire constantly, too, while the key is pressed.

    Sample Usage

     
 Button button = new Button("I'll fire constantly");
 button.setOnAction(new EventHandler<ActionEvent>()} {
      @Override
      public void handle(ActionEvent actionEvent) {
         System.out.println("Fired!");
      }
 });
 ClickRepeater.install(button);
    Author:
    Christian Schudt

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener<java.lang.Boolean> changeListener
      Store the change listener, so that it can be removed in the uninstall(javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase) method.
      private javafx.animation.PauseTransition initialPause
      This is the initial pause until the button is fired for the first time.
      private javafx.animation.PauseTransition pauseTransition
      This is for all the following intervals, after the first one. 80 ms is also used by key events.
      private javafx.animation.SequentialTransition sequentialTransition
      This transition combines the first two.

    • Field Detail

      • initialPause

        private final javafx.animation.PauseTransition initialPause
        This is the initial pause until the button is fired for the first time. This is 500 ms as it the same value used by key events.

      • pauseTransition

        private final javafx.animation.PauseTransition pauseTransition
        This is for all the following intervals, after the first one. 80 ms is also used by key events.

      • sequentialTransition

        private final javafx.animation.SequentialTransition sequentialTransition
        This transition combines the first two.

      • changeListener

        private final javafx.beans.value.ChangeListener<java.lang.Boolean> changeListener
        Store the change listener, so that it can be removed in the uninstall(javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase) method.

      • install

        public static void install(javafx.scene.control.ButtonBase buttonBase)
        Installs the click repeating behavior for a ButtonBase. The default click interval is 80ms.
        Parameters:
        buttonBase - The button.

      • install

           javafx.util.Duration interval)
        Installs the click repeating behavior for a ButtonBase and also allows to set a click interval.
        Parameters:
        buttonBase - The button.
        interval - The click interval.
